DD_Attribute.name: body_positive_pole_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: In the displayed image, the angle of the direction of the positive rotation pole of the associated body, measured at the center of the image, clockwise from the positive vertical

DD_Attribute.name: celestial_north_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: In the displayed image, the angle of the direction of the north celestial pole, measured at the center of the image, clockwise from the positive vertical

DD_Attribute.name: comment
DD_Attribute.definition: Free-format text for miscellaneous comments to the end user about the associated attributes or their values.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_system_origin
DD_Attribute.definition: One of a set of predefined strings that indicates the origin of a coordinate system used for the association coordinates

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The coordinate system origin is at the center of mass of the spacecraft.

DD_Attribute.name: declination
DD_Attribute.definition: Declination in the associated celestrial reference frame and coordinate system

DD_Attribute.name: distance
DD_Attribute.definition: Absolute value of the linear distance between two associated points

DD_Attribute.name: ecliptic_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Ecliptic latitude in the associated reference frame and coordinate system

DD_Attribute.name: ecliptic_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Ecliptic longitude in the associated reference frame and coordinate system

DD_Attribute.name: ecliptic_north_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: In the displayed image, the angle of the direction of the north ecliptic pole, measured at the center of the image, clockwise from the positive vertical

DD_Attribute.name: geometry_reference_time
DD_Attribute.definition: This is the UTC time at which all the geometric values following were calculated, unless an attribute within a class specifies otherwise.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_display_axis
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_display_axis attribute identifies, by name, the axis of an Array (or Array subclass) that is intended to be displayed in the horizontal or "sample" dimension on a display device. The value of this attribute must match the value of one, and only one, axis_name attribute in an Axis_Array class of the associated Array.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_display_direction
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_display_direction attribute specifies the direction across the screen of a display device that data along the horizontal axis of an Array is supposed to be displayed.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The image should be drawn so that the (0,0) pixel is located on the left edge of the displayed image, and subsequent columns should be drawn to the right.
The image should be drawn so that the (0,0) pixel is located on the right edge of the displayed image, and subsequent columns should be drawn to the left.

DD_Attribute.name: light_time_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Flag indicating whether a light travel time correction has been applied to the associated values. A value of "true" indicates it has been applied; "false" indicates no correction has been applied.

DD_Attribute.name: phase_angle
DD_Attribute.definition:
Angle, measured at the target, from the position of the source of illumination to the line of sight
[Note: This definition is not sufficiently specific. It does not include direction of measurement or range of valid values. And the primary to secondary indication is a guess.]

DD_Attribute.name: reference_frame_id
DD_Attribute.definition: An abbreviation for the reference frame for corresponding vector components

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The coordinates are given in the J2000 reference epoch and equinox.
The coordinates are given in the International Celestial Reference Frame.

DD_Attribute.name: right_ascension
DD_Attribute.definition: Right ascension in the associated celestial reference frame and coordinate system

DD_Attribute.name: solar_elongation
DD_Attribute.definition:
The angle between the line of sight to the center of the specified target in the associated image and the direction of the sun as seen by the observer
[ Note: This definition is not sufficiently specific. ]

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: Distance from the center of the Earth to the center of mass of the spacecraft

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: Distance from the center of the sun to the center of mass of the spacecraft

DD_Attribute.name: stellar_aberration_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: This flag indicates whether a correction for stellar aberration has been applied to the associated coordinates. A value of "true" indicates that the correction has been applied; "false" indicates no correction for aberration has beem applied.

DD_Attribute.name: sun_direction_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: In the displayed image, the angle of the direction vector to the sun projected onto the plane of the image, measured at the center of the image, clockwise from the positive vertical

DD_Attribute.name: target_LID
DD_Attribute.definition: The logical identifier (LID) in the PDS4 repository of a context object describing the target

DD_Attribute.name: target_NAIF_ID
DD_Attribute.definition: The NAIF SPK-ID of the target body, if any

DD_Attribute.name: target_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name of the target of interest. For planets, minor planets, and similar observational targets, this should be a name string that includes at least two forms of identification whenever possible, to help with disambiguation in the archive indices.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_display_axis
DD_Attribute.definition: The vertical_display_axis attribute identifies, by name, the axis of an Array (or Array subclass) that is intended to be displayed in the vertical or "line" dimension on a display device. The value of this attribute must match the value of one, and only one, axis_name attribute in an Axis_Array class of the associated Array.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_display_direction
DD_Attribute.definition: The vertical_display_direction attribute specifies the direction along the screen of a display device that data along the vertical axis of an Array is supposed to be displayed.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The image should be drawn so that the (0,0) pixel is located at the top of the displayed image, and subsequent rows are drawn downward.
The image should be drawn so that the (0,0) pixel is located at the bottom of the displayed image, and subsequent rows are drawn upward.

DD_Attribute.name: Vx
DD_Attribute.definition: X component of the associated velocity vector

DD_Attribute.name: Vy
DD_Attribute.definition: Y component of the associated velocity vector

DD_Attribute.name: Vz
DD_Attribute.definition: Z component of the associated velocity vector

DD_Attribute.name: x
DD_Attribute.definition: X-component of a Cartesian distance vector

DD_Attribute.name: y
DD_Attribute.definition: Y component of a Cartesion distance vector

DD_Attribute.name: z
DD_Attribute.definition: Z component of a Cartesion distance vector

DD_Class.name: Celestial_Coordinates
DD_Class.definition: This class specifies right ascension and declination in a specific reference frame and coordinate system.

DD_Class.name: Display_Direction
DD_Class.definition: This class mimics the Display_Direction class in the Display dictionary. It's here until I figure out how to include that class directly.

DD_Class.name: Ecliptic_Coordinates
DD_Class.definition: This class specifies ecliptic latitude and longitude in a specified reference frame and coordinate system.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_to_Earth_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Position vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the spacecraft to the center of mass of the earth

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_to_Earth_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Velocity vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the spacecraft to the center of mass of the earth

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_to_Sun_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Position vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the spacecraft to the center of mass of the sun

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_to_Sun_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Velocity vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the spacecraft to the center of mass of the sun

DD_Class.name: Target_Specification
DD_Class.definition: This class provides a number of ways to identify a single, specific target. In general, any or all of them may be used.

DD_Class.name: Earth_to_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Position vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the earth to the center of mass of the specified target

DD_Class.name: Earth_to_Target_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Velocity vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the earth to the center of mass of the specified target

DD_Class.name: Illumination_Angles
DD_Class.definition: This class collects illumination angles relevant to the specified target.

DD_Class.name: Image_Center_Coordinates
DD_Class.definition: This class provides coordinates of the center of the image in various reference frames and coordinate systems.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_to_Target_Distance
DD_Class.definition: Linear distance measured from the center of the spacecraft to the center of the associated target

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_to_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Position vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the spacecraft to the center of mass of the specified target

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_to_Target_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Velocity vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the spacecraft to the center of mass of the specified target

DD_Class.name: Sun_to_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Position vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the sun to the center of mass of the specified target

DD_Class.name: Sun_to_Target_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Velocity vector in Cartesian coordinates, in the specified reference frame and coordinate system, from the center of mass of the sun to the center of mass of the specified target

DD_Class.name: Target_Geocentric_Distance
DD_Class.definition: Linear distance from the center of the earth to the center of mass of the associated target

DD_Class.name: Target_Heliocentric_Distance
DD_Class.definition: Linear distance from the center of the sun to the center of mass of the associated target

DD_Class.name: Target_Pole_Clock_Angle
DD_Class.definition: This class specifies a target and the clock angle for the positive rotation pole of that target as seen in the associated image, when it is properly displayed.

DD_Class.name: Clock_Angles
DD_Class.definition: This class contains clock angles specifying key directions in the associated image when it is displayed correctly.

DD_Class.name: Distances
DD_Class.definition: Various distance measurements relevant to the product observation

DD_Class.name: Earth_Vectors
DD_Class.definition: This class collects vectors that have their origin at the center of mass of the Earth.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_Vectors
DD_Class.definition: This class collects vectors with their origin at the center of mass of the spacecraft.

DD_Class.name: Sun_Vectors
DD_Class.definition: This class collects vectors with their origin at the center of mass of the Sun.

DD_Class.name: Image_Display_Geometry
DD_Class.definition: This class incorporates the Display Dictionary display class and includes orientation atttributes for key directions as they appear in the correctly displayed image.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_Geometry
DD_Class.definition: This class combines a number of classes related to the geometry of a spacecraft-based observation.

DD_Class.name: Geometry
DD_Class.definition: This master class contains all the geometry dictionary classes and should be included directly in observational product levels in the "Mission_Area".
